title: Algebraic expression
summary: In mathematics, an algebraic expression is an expression built up from constant algebraic numbers, variables, and the algebraic operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division and exponentiation by an exponent that is a rational number).[1] For example, 3x2 âˆ’ 2xy + c is an algebraic expression.
